name: Python
description: A versatile, high-level programming language with extensive libraries for web development (Django, Flask), data science, machine learning, automation, scientific computing, and scripting. Known for readability, rapid development, and strong community support.

name: JavaScript
description: A dynamic, high-level scripting language essential for front-end web development and interactive UIs. With Node.js, enables server-side programming. Supports event-driven, functional, and imperative paradigms, with powerful async/await patterns.

name: TypeScript
description: A statically typed superset of JavaScript adding optional types, interfaces, and classes. Compiles to plain JavaScript, improving code quality, maintainability, and IDE support for large-scale applications.

name: Java
description: A robust, object-oriented, platform-independent language widely used for enterprise applications, Android development, and backend systems with Spring Boot, Hibernate, and Jakarta EE.

name: C#
description: A modern, object-oriented language by Microsoft, used for Windows applications, web services with .NET/ASP.NET, game development with Unity, and enterprise solutions.

name: C++
description: A powerful, high-performance language offering low-level memory manipulation. Used for system software, game engines (Unreal Engine), embedded systems, real-time processing, and performance-critical applications.

name: Go
description: A statically typed, compiled language by Google designed for efficiency, concurrency, and simplicity. Widely used for cloud infrastructure, microservices, networking tools, CLI applications, and backend services.

name: Ruby
description: A dynamic, expressive language prioritizing developer productivity and happiness. Popular for rapid web development, especially with Ruby on Rails, metaprogramming, and DevOps scripting.

name: PHP
description: A widely-used, open-source server-side scripting language tailored for web development. Powers content management systems like WordPress, Drupal, and Laravel applications.

name: Swift
description: A powerful, modern language by Apple for macOS, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS development. Known for safety features, performance optimization, and modern syntax combining readability with type safety.

name: Kotlin
description: A modern, statically typed language targeting JVM, Android, JavaScript, and Native platforms. Offers concise syntax, null safety, and seamless Java interoperability. Official Android development language.

name: Rust
description: A systems programming language emphasizing safety, speed, and concurrency without garbage collection. Used for systems software, WebAssembly, embedded systems, and performance-critical applications.

name: C
description: A procedural, low-level language providing direct memory access and minimal overhead. Fundamental for embedded systems, operating systems, compilers, and performance-critical applications.

name: Bash
description: A Unix shell and command language widely used for system administration scripting, automation, and DevOps workflows on Linux and macOS systems.

name: Scala
description: A statically typed language combining object-oriented and functional programming paradigms on the JVM. Used in big data frameworks like Apache Spark.

name: Elixir
description: A functional language built on the Erlang VM (BEAM) designed for distributed, fault-tolerant, real-time systems. Popular for backend services with Phoenix framework.

name: Erlang
description: A functional language designed for concurrent, distributed, fault-tolerant systems. Powers telecom infrastructure and real-time messaging systems.

name: Haskell
description: A purely functional, statically typed language emphasizing immutability and lazy evaluation. Used for financial systems, compilers, and academic research.

name: Dart
description: An object-oriented, statically typed language developed by Google. Used primarily with Flutter for building cross-platform mobile, web, and desktop applications.

name: HTML
description: HyperText Markup Language standardizing web page structure. Essential foundation for web development, defining semantic meaning and content hierarchy.

name: CSS
description: Cascading Style Sheets language for visual styling, layout, animations, and responsive design. Critical for modern web development and user experience.

name: Sass/SCSS
description: A CSS preprocessor adding variables, nesting, mixins, and functions, making stylesheets more maintainable, scalable, and DRY.

name: Tailwind CSS
description: A utility-first CSS framework enabling rapid UI development through composable, low-level CSS classes without leaving HTML.

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building dynamic, component-based UIs and single-page applications (SPAs). Provides efficient state management, hooks, context API, and ecosystem tools.

name: Angular
description: A comprehensive TypeScript-based framework by Google for building large-scale, feature-rich SPAs. Includes dependency injection, RxJS integration, and CLI tooling.

name: Vue.js
description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and SPAs. Known for approachability, flexibility, progressive enhancement, and gentle learning curve.

name: Svelte
description: A radical new approach to building UIs that compiles components at build time, resulting in highly optimized, less JavaScript sent to browser.

name: SolidJS
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces combining JSX syntax with fine-grained reactivity and minimal overhead.

name: Astro
description: A modern web framework for building fast, static-first websites with island architecture and partial hydration for optimal performance.

name: Remix
description: A modern web framework focusing on full-stack JavaScript development, server-side rendering (SSR), and leveraging HTTP standards.

name: Next.js
description: A React-based framework enabling server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), API routes, and optimized production builds for performant web applications.

name: Nuxt.js
description: A Vue-based framework for building universal applications with SSR, static generation, and integrated routing and state management.

name: Node.js
description: A JavaScript runtime environment using Chrome's V8 engine, enabling server-side JavaScript execution. Powers backend services, APIs, real-time applications, and command-line tools.

name: Express.js
description: A minimal, flexible Node.js web framework providing routing, middleware, and core web server functionality for building APIs and web applications.

name: Fastify
description: A fast and low-overhead Node.js web framework focused on performance, with schema validation, plugin system, and built-in logger.

name: NestJS
description: A progressive Node.js framework for building scalable, maintainable backend applications. Combines TypeScript, decorators, and modular architecture with dependency injection.

name: Django
description: A high-level Python web framework emphasizing rapid development and clean design. Follows MTV pattern with built-in ORM, admin panel, authentication, and security features.

name: Flask
description: A lightweight, extensible Python microframework for building smaller applications, APIs, and prototypes quickly with maximum flexibility.

name: FastAPI
description: A modern, high-performance Python web framework for building fast APIs with automatic documentation, data validation, and async support.

name: Spring Boot
description: A Java framework simplifying creation of production-grade, stand-alone Spring applications with auto-configuration, embedded servers, and microservices support.

name: Ruby on Rails
description: A server-side web framework emphasizing convention over configuration, enabling rapid development of database-driven web applications.

name: .NET Core / ASP.NET Core
description: Microsoft's modern, cross-platform framework for building web applications, APIs, and microservices using C#. Includes Blazor for server and client-side development.

name: Laravel
description: A PHP web framework prioritizing elegant syntax and rapid development. Includes ORM (Eloquent), routing, authentication, and extensive ecosystem.

name: Gin (Go)
description: A lightweight, fast web framework for Go with middleware support, routing, and JSON serialization for building APIs and services.

name: Fiber (Go)
description: A high-performance web framework for Go inspired by Express.js, designed for building fast microservices and APIs.

name: Ktor (Kotlin)
description: A lightweight, asynchronous web framework for Kotlin for building web services and microservices with coroutines.

name: Phoenix (Elixir)
description: A web framework for Elixir enabling real-time applications with WebSockets, built-in ORM (Ecto), and functional programming patterns.

name: REST API Design
description: Designing RESTful web services leveraging HTTP semantics, resource-oriented architecture, stateless communication, and standard methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).

name: GraphQL
description: A query language and runtime for APIs enabling clients to request only required data, reducing over-fetching and under-fetching compared to REST.

name: gRPC
description: A high-performance RPC framework by Google using Protocol Buffers for serialization, enabling efficient microservice communication with multiplexing.

name: Protocol Buffers
description: A method of serializing structured data by Google, enabling language and platform-independent data interchange for APIs and microservices.

name: OpenAPI / Swagger
description: A standardized specification for describing RESTful APIs, enabling automatic documentation, client generation, and testing.

name: AsyncAPI
description: A specification for describing asynchronous APIs, supporting event-driven and message-based communication patterns.

name: API Integration
description: Connecting software applications via APIs to enable data exchange and functionality sharing across systems and platforms.

name: Webhook Development
description: Implementing callback mechanisms allowing external services to trigger actions in your application through HTTP callbacks.

name: PostgreSQL
description: A powerful open-source relational database supporting complex queries, advanced data types, and strong reliability for enterprise applications.

name: MySQL
description: An open-source RDBMS widely used in web applications, known for ease of use, reliability, and scalability.

name: MongoDB
description: A popular NoSQL document-oriented database storing flexible JSON-like documents (BSON), designed for scalability and agile development.

name: Redis
description: An in-memory key-value data store used for high-performance caching, session management, real-time analytics, and message brokering.

name: Elasticsearch
description: A distributed search and analytics engine supporting full-text search, log analytics, real-time monitoring with Kibana visualization.

name: SQL
description: The standard language for querying, manipulating, and managing data in relational databases across MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and Oracle.

name: Snowflake
description: A cloud-native data platform optimized for analytics and data warehousing with separation of compute and storage, and native support for semi-structured data.

name: BigQuery
description: Google Cloud's serverless, scalable data warehouse for analytics and machine learning on large datasets.

name: Redshift
description: Amazon's fully managed data warehouse service for analytics and business intelligence on large-scale datasets.

name: Databricks
description: A unified analytics platform combining Apache Spark with Delta Lake for data engineering, analytics, and machine learning workflows.

name: Cassandra
description: A distributed NoSQL database designed for high-availability, horizontal scalability, and fault tolerance across multiple data centers.

name: DynamoDB
description: AWS's fully managed NoSQL database offering fast, scalable performance with automatic scaling for unpredictable workloads.

name: CouchDB
description: A distributed NoSQL database offering document storage, replication, and easy HTTP API for building offline-first applications.

name: Firestore
description: Google's cloud-hosted NoSQL database with real-time synchronization, offline support, and strong consistency guarantees.

name: Docker
description: A containerization platform enabling developers to package applications with dependencies into isolated containers, ensuring consistency across environments.

name: Kubernetes
description: An open-source orchestration system automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications across clusters.

name: Helm
description: A package manager for Kubernetes enabling templating, deployment automation, and release management of applications.

name: Kustomize
description: A template-free customization tool for Kubernetes YAML manifests enabling configuration management without templating.

name: Argo CD
description: A GitOps continuous deployment tool for Kubernetes enabling declarative application management synced from Git repositories.

name: Flux
description: A GitOps tool for Kubernetes automating application deployment and cluster configuration through Git-driven workflows.

name: AWS (Amazon Web Services)
description: Amazon's comprehensive cloud platform offering compute (EC2), storage (S3), databases (RDS), machine learning, networking, and 200+ services.

name: AWS EC2
description: Amazon's elastic compute cloud service providing resizable virtual machines (instances) with flexible pricing and scaling options.

name: AWS S3
description: Amazon's object storage service offering scalable, durable storage for data of any size with built-in redundancy and security.

name: AWS Lambda
description: AWS's serverless compute service enabling execution of code without provisioning or managing servers, billing by usage.

name: AWS RDS
description: AWS's managed relational database service supporting MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, SQL Server with automated backups and scaling.

name: AWS DynamoDB
description: AWS's fully managed NoSQL database with automatic scaling and consistent performance for applications with variable workloads.

name: AWS ECS
description: Amazon's container orchestration service for managing Docker containers with auto-scaling and load balancing.

name: AWS EKS
description: Amazon's managed Kubernetes service handling cluster provisioning, scaling, and operations.

name: Microsoft Azure
description: Microsoft's cloud platform offering virtual machines, AI/ML, storage, analytics, IoT, and enterprise integration services.

name: Azure App Service
description: Microsoft's managed service for hosting web apps, mobile backends, and RESTful APIs with built-in CI/CD and scaling.

name: Azure Functions
description: Microsoft's serverless compute service for event-driven application development without infrastructure management.

name: Azure Cosmos DB
description: Microsoft's globally distributed, multi-model database supporting SQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, and Gremlin APIs.

name: Azure AKS
description: Azure's managed Kubernetes service simplifying deployment and management of containerized applications.

name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
description: Google's cloud platform with compute, storage, big data, machine learning, and analytics services built on Google's infrastructure.

name: Google Compute Engine
description: GCP's scalable computing service providing virtual machines with custom machine types and per-minute billing.

name: Google Cloud Functions
description: Google's serverless execution environment for event-driven code with automatic scaling and simplified operations.

name: Google Cloud Storage
description: GCP's object storage service with global redundancy, strong consistency, and unified namespace.

name: Google Cloud SQL
description: GCP's managed relational database service supporting MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server.

name: Google Cloud Pub/Sub
description: GCP's scalable messaging service enabling asynchronous, distributed communication for event-driven applications.

name: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE)
description: GCP's managed Kubernetes service with automatic upgrades, scaling, and multi-zone clusters.

name: CI/CD Pipelines
description: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment practices automating build, test, and deployment using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.

name: GitHub Actions
description: GitHub's native CI/CD platform enabling automated workflows triggered by repository events for testing, building, and deploying code.

name: GitLab CI/CD
description: GitLab's integrated CI/CD platform with pipelines, runners, and artifact management for automated testing and deployment.

name: Jenkins
description: An open-source automation server enabling complex CI/CD pipelines with extensive plugin ecosystem for build, test, and deployment automation.

name: CircleCI
description: A cloud-based CI/CD platform with fast builds, parallel job execution, and integration with VCS and deployment tools.

name: Terraform
description: An infrastructure-as-code tool enabling declarative provisioning and management of cloud resources across AWS, Azure, GCP, and others.

name: Ansible
description: An open-source automation and configuration management tool using YAML playbooks for infrastructure provisioning and application deployment.

name: Packer
description: A tool by HashiCorp for building machine images automatically from configuration for multiple cloud platforms.

name: Vagrant
description: A tool for building and managing portable development environments using virtual machines with infrastructure-as-code approach.

name: HashiCorp Vault
description: A tool for managing secrets, encryption keys, and sensitive data with centralized access control and audit logging.

name: Consul
description: HashiCorp's service mesh and configuration management tool enabling service discovery, health checking, and dynamic configuration.

name: Git
description: A distributed version control system for tracking code changes, enabling collaboration, branching, and version history management.

name: GitHub
description: A cloud-based Git repository hosting service with collaboration features, pull requests, issues, and CI/CD integration.

name: GitLab
description: A DevOps platform providing Git hosting, CI/CD, container registry, and project management in one integrated system.

name: Bitbucket
description: Atlassian's Git-based repository hosting with built-in CI/CD, security features, and Jira integration.

name: Linux Administration
description: Managing Linux systems including user management, package installation, shell scripting, system monitoring, and server maintenance.

name: Windows Server Administration
description: Managing Windows Server systems including Active Directory, Group Policy, IIS, user management, and security configuration.

name: Shell Scripting (Bash/Sh)
description: Writing Unix/Linux shell scripts for task automation, system administration, and DevOps workflows.

name: PowerShell Scripting
description: Microsoft's command-line shell and scripting language built on .NET for system administration and automation on Windows.

name: Machine Learning (ML)
description: Building systems that learn from data to identify patterns, make predictions, and improve decision-making with minimal human intervention.

name: Deep Learning (DL)
description: Subset of ML using artificial neural networks with multiple layers for complex tasks like image recognition and NLP.

name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description: AI field enabling computers to process, understand, and generate human language for applications like sentiment analysis and chatbots.

name: Computer Vision (CV)
description: AI field training computers to interpret visual information from images and videos for object detection, classification, and recognition.

name: PyTorch
description: An open-source machine learning library by Meta for deep learning with dynamic computation graphs and strong Python integration.

name: TensorFlow
description: Google's end-to-end machine learning platform with Keras API for building and deploying ML applications across devices.

name: Scikit-learn
description: Python library providing tools for data mining and machine learning including classification, regression, clustering, and dimensionality reduction.

name: LangChain
description: A framework for developing applications with LLMs, enabling chaining of language model calls with memory, tools, and agents.

name: Hugging Face
description: A platform providing pre-trained transformer models and datasets for NLP, computer vision, and audio tasks with easy integration.

name: Weights & Biases
description: A platform for experiment tracking, hyperparameter optimization, and model management for machine learning projects.

name: MLflow
description: An open-source platform for managing ML lifecycle including experiment tracking, model packaging, and deployment.

name: Kubeflow
description: A Kubernetes-based platform for deploying and managing machine learning workflows with ML pipeline orchestration.

name: Vertex AI
description: Google Cloud's managed ML platform providing tools for building, training, and deploying ML models with AutoML capabilities.

name: SageMaker
description: Amazon's fully managed ML service providing tools for building, training, and deploying models with reduced infrastructure overhead.

name: Pandas
description: Powerful Python library for data manipulation with DataFrames, enabling data cleaning, transformation, and analysis workflows.

name: NumPy
description: Fundamental Python library for numerical computing with arrays and matrices supporting fast mathematical operations.

name: Matplotlib
description: Comprehensive Python library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations in publication quality.

name: Seaborn
description: High-level Python visualization library built on Matplotlib for creating attractive statistical graphics.

name: R Language
description: Programming language and environment specifically designed for statistical computing, data analysis, and graphics.

name: Statistical Analysis
description: Science of collecting, exploring, and interpreting data to discover patterns and insights through hypothesis testing and statistical methods.

name: Data Engineering
description: Designing and building systems for collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing data at scale with robust data pipelines.

name: Data Warehousing
description: Designing central repositories of integrated data from multiple sources for reporting and analytical queries.

name: ETL Development
description: Extract, Transform, Load processes for extracting data from sources, transforming into usable format, and loading into target systems.

name: Apache Spark
description: Distributed processing system for big data analytics with fast in-memory processing for analytics, ML, and stream processing.

name: Apache Kafka
description: Distributed event streaming platform for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications with high throughput.

name: Apache Airflow
description: Workflow orchestration platform for authoring, scheduling, and monitoring data pipelines as directed acyclic graphs (DAGs).

name: Dagster
description: A data orchestrator for building, testing, and monitoring data pipelines with asset-oriented programming.

name: dbt
description: Data build tool enabling data analysts to write modular SQL transformations for data warehousing and analytics workflows.

name: Apache NiFi
description: Data routing and transformation platform with web-based UI for building real-time data flow systems.

name: Airbyte
description: Open-source data integration platform providing pre-built connectors for extracting and loading data across sources and destinations.

name: Fivetran
description: Cloud-based data integration platform with pre-built connectors for automated data pipeline from sources to data warehouses.

name: Apache Pulsar
description: Distributed messaging system supporting multi-tenancy, geo-replication, and real-time stream processing.

name: RabbitMQ
description: Open-source message broker supporting multiple messaging protocols for asynchronous communication and task queuing.

name: NATS
description: Cloud-native messaging platform with high performance and low latency for distributed systems.

name: Delta Lake
description: Open-source storage layer providing ACID transactions, schema enforcement, and time travel capabilities for data lakes.

name: Apache Iceberg
description: Open-source table format for data lakes providing ACID transactions, hidden partitioning, and schema evolution.

name: Apache Hudi
description: Incremental processing framework for Hadoop with support for incremental extraction, upserts, and deletes.

name: Web Scraping & Crawling
description: Automated extraction of large amounts of data from websites using tools like Beautiful Soup, Scrapy, and Selenium.

name: Tableau
description: Interactive data visualization software for creating dashboards, reports, and exploring data for business insights.

name: Microsoft Power BI
description: Business analytics service by Microsoft providing interactive visualizations and reporting for data-driven insights.

name: Google Data Studio
description: Google's free interactive data visualization and dashboard creation tool connecting to various data sources.

name: Looker
description: BI and data visualization platform by Google for creating dashboards, reports, and insights with embedded analytics.

name: Excel (Advanced)
description: Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables, complex formulas, VBA macros, Power Query for business intelligence.

name: Jira
description: Issue tracking and project management tool by Atlassian widely used by agile development teams for bug tracking and sprint planning.

name: Confluence
description: Team collaboration and knowledge management platform by Atlassian for documentation, meeting notes, and team wikis.

name: Monday.com
description: Work management platform providing project tracking, collaboration, and automation tools for teams.

name: Asana
description: Work management platform enabling task tracking, team collaboration, and project organization across teams.

name: Notion
description: All-in-one workspace combining notes, databases, kanban boards, and wikis for team organization.

name: Agile Methodologies
description: Iterative software development principles emphasizing collaboration, customer feedback, and rapid adaptation to change.

name: Scrum Framework
description: Agile framework for managing complex projects using iterative cycles (sprints), defined roles, and specific ceremonies.

name: Kanban System
description: Lean method visualizing workflow, limiting WIP, and focusing on continuous flow and efficiency.

name: Lean Six Sigma
description: Methodology combining lean principles with statistical process improvement for reducing waste and improving quality.

name: Product Management
description: Strategic process of guiding product lifecycle from conception through launch with market research, roadmapping, and cross-functional collaboration.

name: Business Analysis
description: Identifying business needs, analyzing problems, and determining solutions to bridge the gap between business and IT.

name: UI (User Interface) Design
description: Designing visual look, feel, layout, and interactive elements of software applications and websites.

name: UX (User Experience) Design
description: Enhancing user satisfaction through improved usability, accessibility, and interaction design with research and testing.

name: User Research
description: Systematic study of target users through interviews, surveys, usability testing, and persona creation to inform design.

name: Figma
description: Collaborative, web-based interface design tool for UI/UX design, prototyping, design systems, and team collaboration.

name: Adobe XD
description: Vector-based UX design tool for designing, prototyping, and sharing user experiences for web and mobile apps.

name: Sketch
description: Mac-based UI design tool focused on interface design with powerful layers, symbols, and design systems support.

name: Adobe Photoshop
description: Powerful raster graphics editor for image editing, photo retouching, and graphic design.

name: Adobe Illustrator
description: Vector graphics editor for creating logos, icons, illustrations, typography, and scalable graphics.

name: Adobe InDesign
description: Desktop publishing software for creating layouts, brochures, magazines, and other print and digital publications.

name: Blender
description: Free, open-source 3D creation suite supporting modeling, animation, rendering, and visual effects.

name: Quality Assurance (QA)
description: Systematic process ensuring software products meet specified requirements and quality standards through testing.

name: Manual Testing
description: Manually testing software by executing test cases and verifying actual results against expected results.

name: Automated Testing
description: Using software tools to execute pre-scripted tests on applications including unit, integration, and end-to-end tests.

name: Unit Testing
description: Testing individual units or components of source code in isolation to ensure fitness for use.

name: Integration Testing
description: Testing where individual software modules are combined and tested as a group to ensure proper integration.

name: End-to-End (E2E) Testing
description: Testing complete application workflows from user perspective to ensure all integrated components work correctly.

name: Performance Testing
description: Testing application performance under various load conditions to ensure responsiveness and stability.

name: Selenium WebDriver
description: Open-source framework for automating web browser interactions for automated testing across browsers.

name: Jest
description: JavaScript testing framework focused on simplicity, widely used for testing React, Node.js, and JavaScript codebases.

name: Cypress.io
description: Modern end-to-end JavaScript testing framework for web applications with easy syntax and debugging.

name: Playwright
description: End-to-end testing framework by Microsoft supporting multiple browsers with powerful automation capabilities.

name: Vitest
description: Unit testing framework for JavaScript with Vite support, providing fast test execution and modern syntax.

name: Mocha
description: JavaScript testing framework with flexible test runner, assertion library, and plugin support.

name: Chai
description: Assertion library for JavaScript supporting BDD and TDD testing styles with expressive assertions.

name: Mobile Application Development
description: Creating software applications for mobile devices including native, cross-platform, and progressive web approaches.

name: Android Development (Native)
description: Creating native Android applications using Kotlin or Java and Android SDK with platform-specific features.

name: iOS Development (Native)
description: Creating native iOS applications using Swift or Objective-C and iOS SDK with platform-specific features.

name: React Native
description: JavaScript framework for building natively rendering mobile applications for iOS and Android from single codebase.

name: Flutter
description: UI framework by Google for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from single codebase.

name: SwiftUI
description: Apple's modern UI framework for building user interfaces for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS with declarative syntax.

name: Jetpack Compose
description: Android's modern UI framework for building native interfaces with Kotlin using declarative programming.

name: Kotlin Multiplatform
description: Kotlin framework for sharing code across iOS, Android, web, and desktop applications.

name: Ionic
description: Cross-platform mobile framework for building iOS, Android, and web applications with web technologies.

name: Capacitor
description: JavaScript bridge for building iOS, Android, and web apps with access to native APIs.

name: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: Core principles and practices for protecting systems, networks, and data from digital attacks and unauthorized access.

name: Penetration Testing
description: Simulated cyber attacks to identify vulnerabilities before attackers do, also known as ethical hacking.

name: OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect
description: Open standards for access delegation and authentication widely used for authorization and SSO protocols.

name: Auth0
description: Cloud-based identity and access management platform providing authentication and authorization services.

name: Okta
description: Identity and access management platform providing single sign-on, MFA, and lifecycle management.

name: Keycloak
description: Open-source identity and access management solution providing SSO and user federation.

name: Burp Suite
description: Web vulnerability scanner and testing framework for security testing of web applications.

name: OWASP ZAP
description: Open source web application security scanner identifying vulnerabilities in web applications.

name: Snyk
description: Developer security platform for finding and fixing vulnerabilities in code, dependencies, and containers.

name: Trivy
description: Open source vulnerability scanner for containers and code focusing on simplicity and speed.

name: HashiCorp Vault
description: Secrets management tool for protecting credentials, encryption keys, and sensitive data with centralized access control.

name: OPA (Open Policy Agent)
description: General-purpose policy engine enabling fine-grained, context-aware authorization across applications.

name: Kyverno
description: Kubernetes policy management engine for enforcing security policies and compliance requirements.

name: Splunk
description: Security information and event management (SIEM) platform for log aggregation, monitoring, and security analytics.

name: Salesforce CRM
description: Customer relationship management platform for sales, service, and marketing operations.

name: SAP ERP
description: Enterprise resource planning system for managing business operations including finance, supply chain, and HR.

name: HubSpot
description: Customer relationship management and marketing automation platform for sales, marketing, and service teams.

name: Zendesk
description: Customer service platform providing ticketing, knowledge base, and multi-channel support.

name: Intercom
description: Customer communication platform providing live chat, messaging, and customer data platform.

name: Slack Admin
description: Administration and management of Slack workspaces including user management, security, and integrations.

name: Stripe
description: Payment processing platform enabling businesses to accept online payments and manage transactions.

name: Shopify
description: E-commerce platform for building and managing online stores with payments, inventory, and marketing.

name: Communication Skills
description: Effectively conveying information verbally and in writing including active listening, clarity, and audience adaptation.

name: Problem-Solving
description: Identifying, analyzing, and resolving complex issues through critical thinking, creativity, and analytical skills.

name: Teamwork & Collaboration
description: Working effectively with others to achieve common goals through cooperation and shared responsibility.

name: Leadership & Management
description: Guiding, motivating, and managing individuals or teams to achieve objectives with decision-making and delegation.

name: Time Management & Organization
description: Planning and controlling time for activities to increase efficiency through prioritization and scheduling.

name: Adaptability & Learning
description: Quickly learning new skills and adapting to changing circumstances, technologies, and work environments.

name: Conflict Resolution
description: Resolving disputes and disagreements between team members through mediation, negotiation, and collaborative problem-solving.

name: Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA)
description: Fundamental CS concepts for designing efficient ways to store, process, and solve computational problems.

name: System Design & Architecture
description: Defining architecture, components, and interfaces for systems ensuring scalability, reliability, and maintainability.

name: Microservices Architecture
description: Structuring applications as collection of small, autonomous, independently deployable services for scalability.

name: Service Mesh
description: Infrastructure layer managing service-to-service communication in microservices architectures with observability and security.

name: Istio
description: Service mesh platform providing traffic management, security policies, and observability for Kubernetes microservices.

name: Linkerd
description: Lightweight service mesh for Kubernetes providing reliability, performance, and security for microservices.

name: Envoy
description: Proxy and communication bus designed for large distributed systems at microservice and service mesh level.

name: Serverless Computing
description: Cloud execution model where providers manage servers, developers focus on code as Functions as a Service (FaaS).

name: Edge Computing
description: Computing architecture processing data closer to data source reducing latency and bandwidth requirements.

name: Cloudflare Workers
description: Serverless computing platform running JavaScript at Cloudflare's edge network for minimal latency.

name: Vercel
description: Platform for deploying and hosting frontend applications with serverless functions and edge network.

name: Netlify
description: Platform for deploying and hosting web applications with serverless functions and edge computing.

name: Akamai
description: Content delivery network and edge computing platform for performance, security, and reliability.

name: Fastly
description: CDN and edge computing platform for fast content delivery and real-time performance.

name: Blockchain Technology
description: Decentralized, distributed ledger technology for secure transaction recording and building decentralized applications.

name: Internet of Things (IoT)
description: Network of interconnected physical devices collecting and exchanging data with embedded sensors and connectivity.

name: Technical Writing & Documentation
description: Creating clear, accurate technical documentation including API guides, user manuals, and specifications.

name: A/B Testing & Experimentation
description: Comparing two versions to determine which performs better based on metrics for data-driven product decisions.

name: Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
